required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Pyrotinib Plus Vinorelbine in Patients With Brain Metastases From HER2-positive Metastatic Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Pyrotinib Plus Vinorelbine in Patients With Brain Metastases From HER2-positive Metastatic Breast Cancer : a Prospective, Single-arm, Open-label Study

brief_summary.textblock: Pyrotinib is an oral tyrosine kinase inhibitor targeting both HER1, HER2 and HER4 receptors. This study is a single-arm, prospective, open label clinical study of pyrotinib plus vinorelbine as the therapy of brain metastases from HER2-positive metastatic breast cancer.

primary_outcome.description: ORR, defined as proportion of complete response and partial response according to RANO-Brain Metastases (RANO-BM) criteria.

secondary_outcome.description: TTP, defined as the time from the date of informed consent until the date of disease progression (PD), either CNS PD or extracranial PD, whichever comes first.
OS, defined as the time from the date of informed consent until to the date of death, regardless of the cause of death.
Time to radiotherapy, defined as the time from the date of informed consent until to the date of radiotherapy.

intervention.description: Pyrotinib: 320mg/d, q.d., p.o. A course of treatment need 21 days. Vinorelbine: 60mg/m2 q.d. d1,8,15, p.o. A course of treatment need 21 day.

overall_official.affiliation: Cancer Institute and Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences

facility.name: Cancer Institute and Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences

clinical_study.keyword: Breast cancer, Brain metastases, Pyrotinib, Vinorelbine, HER2
